Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town and Airport Development
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting of 'Ghost Town' and Nan's dissatisfaction with it, contrasting her romantic ideals with reality. It then reveals the imminent development of an airport, threatening the town's existence and deeply affecting Nan.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Discontent and Cal's Rejection
sub_scenes.description: Nan expresses her unhappiness with life in 'Ghost Town' and rejects Cal's advances, highlighting her desire for a more exciting life.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Rejection and the Ghost Town Mystery

sub_scenes.title: Airport Announcement and Nan's Distress
sub_scenes.description: The arrival of men discussing airport plans reveals the impending demolition of 'Ghost Town', causing Nan significant emotional distress.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Frustrated Departure from Ghost Town
Arrival at Merrick Gulch and the 'Ghost Town' Label
Airport Development Plans for the Ghost Town
Nan's Distress and Realization of Ghost Town's Demolition

Major_Arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Evolving Relationship Amidst Change
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the fluctuating relationship between Nan and Cal as they navigate the news of the airport development and their personal feelings. It moves from misunderstanding and harsh reactions to apology, reflection, and eventual reconciliation.

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Practical Perspectives
sub_scenes.description: Nan apologizes to Cal and tries to take a practical view of the airport, while Cal expresses cynicism and disillusionment.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Apology and Practical View of the Airport
Nan's Reflection on Her Harsh Reaction to Cal
Cal's Cynical Monologue on Love and Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Parental Advice
sub_scenes.description: Nan faces unwelcome advances, discusses airport practicalities, argues with her father, and receives contrasting advice from her parents and maid about love and relationships.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Rough Men and Nan's Resistance
Nan's Airport Frustration and Father's Dismissiveness
Horses for Construction and Father-Daughter Argument
Nan's Humiliation and Reflection in Bed
Mother's Advice on Love and Childishness
Father's Pragmatic Advice to Focus on Cal
Maid's Reassurance of Cal's Love and Need for Patience

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Pursuit and Reconciliation with Cal
sub_scenes.description: Nan resolves to understand Cal's feelings and pursues him, leading to an emotional confession and reunion after a period of separation and loneliness.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Resolve to Know Cal's True Feelings
Horses Arriving and Ranch Hand's Request for Help
Argument with Father About a Deal

Major_Arcs.title: The Great Snowstorm and Community Resilience
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to a severe snowstorm that engulfs the region, causing widespread concern for livestock and resources. It highlights the community's worries, resilience, and eventual relief through external aid.

sub_scenes.title: Weather Concerns and Initial Impact
sub_scenes.description: The severity of the snowstorm is revealed, causing concern about snow depth, fodder stocks, and the overall impact on the community.

sub_scenes.title: Despair, Hope, and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: The community faces despair as the snow deepens, but hope arrives in the form of a plane delivering fodder. This leads to emotional resolution and a reflection on love, change, and progress.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: Arrival of the Plane

Major_Arcs.title: The Ballad of Chane Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and the controversy surrounding his reputation as a 'murdering killer'. It explores public opinion, threats, and a confrontation leading to Benson's departure.

sub_scenes.title: Public Perception and Skepticism of Chane Benson
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is depicted in a confrontation, and onlookers react with skepticism and mockery towards his heroic image.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Sally's Concern
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses concern over Jeff's fascination with guns and his emulation of figures like Chane Benson, leading to a confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Mr. Benson's Ominous Warning and Public Outcry
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Benson provides a grim description of Chane Benson, and public discussion arises regarding an article labeling Chane as a murderer.

narrative_arcs.title: Ominous Advice and Mention of Violence
Public Discussion about Chane Benson's Reputation and Article

sub_scenes.title: Office Confrontation and Sally's Warnings
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson confronts Clyde about the article, threatening him, while Sally warns Clyde of Benson's dangerous nature.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Warning in the Office
Clyde's Determination to Publish Articles Despite Threats

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation and Awkward Encounter
sub_scenes.description: Public reaction to Clyde's articles escalates tension. A dinner invitation for Chane Benson is considered, leading to an awkward dinner and Jeff's strange behavior.

narrative_arcs.title: Public Reaction to Clyde's Articles and Jeff's Insight
Considering a Dinner Invitation for Chane Benson
Awkward Dinner and Jeff's Demonstration for Chane

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Confrontation and Benson's Departure
sub_scenes.description: Sally confronts Chane, suspecting his motives. This leads to escalating accusations, a physical confrontation involving Jeff, and ultimately Chane Benson's departure and Sally's resolve to expose him.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Accusation and Chane's Evasive Response
Escalating Accusations and Threat of Violence
Sally's Confrontation with Jeff about Betrayal
Sally's Outburst and Accusation of Manipulation

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Pursuit and Community Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Sally realizes Clyde is in danger and urges Jeff to action. Jeff pursues Chane, leading to a confrontation between Chane and townsmen, ultimately resulting in Benson leaving town.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Danger and Urgent Action
Confrontation with the Editor and Townsmen
Flashback to Clarion Office - The Ticking Clock
Flashback - Uncertainty and Fear Behind the Door
Reflection on Family, Courage, and Decency in Journalism

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy and Steve: A Ranch Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Betsy and Steve Daley, focusing on the ranch troubles Betsy is facing and Steve's arrival to help. It develops their relationship amidst conflict and danger, culminating in a romantic resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Steve's Arrival and Initial Suspicions
sub_scenes.description: Steve Daley arrives at Betsy's ranch, introduced by Hank Galloway, but Betsy harbors initial suspicions about him.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley to Betsy
Confirmation of Hiring and Foreshadowing Trouble
Discussion about Steve's Character and Past

sub_scenes.title: Journey to Town and Confrontation with Bridges
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve journey to town, facing a confrontation with Fred Bridges and his men, showcasing Steve's gunfighting skills and Betsy's defiance.

narrative_arcs.title: Journey to Town and Lingering Doubts
Leaving the Store and Betsy's Sarcasm
Aftermath of the Punch and Further Threat
Discussion on Gunfighters and Hornets' Nest

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Conflicted Feelings and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Betsy reflects on Steve's gunfighter skills and orders him fired, but quickly reconsiders, leading to a direct confrontation and romantic confession culminating in Steve giving up his guns for her.

narrative_arcs.title: Hank's Understanding and Betsy's Romantic Feelings

Major_Arcs.title: Range War and Romantic Climax
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc intensifies the ranch conflict with Old Man Bridges, while Betsy and Steve's romance blossoms amidst the escalating tension. It culminates in a confrontation at Devil's Pass and a romantic resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Ranch Conflict and Betsy's Stance
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges confronts Betsy and Hank, leading to escalating tensions and Betsy taking a firm stand against gun violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Old Man Bridges' Complaint and Hank's Accusation
Betsy and Steve's Confrontation and Steve's Challenge to Hank
Betsy's Stand Against Gun Violence and Concern for Steve
Steve's Reflection on Past Mistakes and the Ambush

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Romantic Finale
sub_scenes.description: Betsy resolves to take action, leading to a confrontation at Devil's Pass where she and Steve overcome challenges, culminating in a romantic reunion and commitment.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Parting and Betsy's Worried Reflection
Betsy's Command and Ride to Devil's Pass
Arrival at Devil's Pass and Ominous Recognition
Betsy's Recovery and Reassurance by Steve

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Fred, and Dave: A Love Triangle and Business Deal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Carrie, Dave, and Fred Gordon, exploring their complex relationships entangled with a business contract. It follows Carrie's journey through love, betrayal, and ultimately, personal triumph.

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Protective Argument and Range Conflict
sub_scenes.description: Carrie argues to protect Dave, while a range conflict arises with the Bar 'C' ranch, setting the stage for business and personal tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubled Arrival and Range Conflict
Explaining the Fence and Herd Concerns
Fred Gordon's Polite but Tense Arrival

sub_scenes.title: Flashback and Conflicted Feelings
sub_scenes.description: Flashbacks reveal Carrie's past with Fred, and present-day conversation highlights her conflicted feelings between Fred and Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie and Dave's Conflicted Feelings about Fred
Present Confrontation: Fred Gordon and Carrie
Carrie's Confession and Dave's Attempt to Reconcile

sub_scenes.title: Deceit, Rejection, and Resolve
sub_scenes.description: Fred's true motives are revealed, leading to Carrie's angry rejection and resolve to confront Mr. Carlton about the contract.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Wisdom on Love and Life

sub_scenes.title: Carrie and Dave's Town Encounter and Revelation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Dave meet in town, leading to Dave questioning Carrie's feelings for Fred and Carrie's eventual confession of love.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Relief and Reflection on Fred

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts her father's pride, and a series of revelations about Fred's sacrifice and brother's intervention lead to Carrie and Fred's romantic reunion and proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Mr. Carlton's Arrival and Carrie's Misinterpretation
Revelation of Fred's Sacrifice and Brother's Intervention
Carrie's Emotional Awakening and Ride to Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance: Brotherhood and Justice
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the complex relationship between Dirk and Rance, exploring themes of brotherhood, duty, and justice as Rance confronts Dirk after a shooting incident, leading to a dramatic wedding day resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Return and Injury Reveal
sub_scenes.description: Dirk returns injured, and his condition is revealed to his sister and a doctor, raising questions about the circumstances of his injury.

sub_scenes.title: Marshal's Pursuit and Ranch Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Marshal Rance Cready arrives at the ranch pursuing Dirk, encountering resistance but uncovering evidence of Dirk's presence and injury.

narrative_arcs.title: Marshal Rance Cready's Arrival and Initial Inquiry
Confirmation of Pursuit and Denial of Dirk's Presence
Rance Cready's Insistence and Proof of Dirk's Presence
Concern for Injured Dirk and Assertion of Law
Rejection of Excuse and Acknowledgment of Change

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and Manipulation
sub_scenes.description: Chris and Rance confront each other emotionally, leading to a love confession and Chris suggesting a plan that Rance ultimately recognizes as manipulative.

narrative_arcs.title: Argument, Confession and Confirmation of Love
Rance's Internal Conflict and Realization of Misjudgment
Rance's Decision, Departure Announcement and Realization of Manipulation

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit, Confrontation, and Shooting
sub_scenes.description: Rance pursues Dirk, leading to a confrontation and shooting, resulting in injury and a moral dilemma.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern about the Marshal and Reassurance
Realization of Pursuit and Urgent Escape
Argument on Handling the Injured Person
Forced Departure and Concern for the Injured

sub_scenes.title: Chris's Return, Recovery, and Wedding Day Disruption
sub_scenes.description: Chris reflects on her love for Rance and returns to him. Rance recovers, leading to a wedding day disrupted by Dirk's dramatic arrival and subsequent explanation and resolution.

narrative_arcs.title: Woman's Reflection and Understanding of Love for Rance
Return to Rance and Confrontation about Injury
Father's Departure and Hint at Private Matters
Expression of Gratitude and Love Confession
Rance's Reflections on Marriage and Dirk
